input_text: LU Factuality: The Persian Gulf War destroyed much of the country's medical infrastructure, according to a report by the World Health Organization.
LU Factuality: In 1996 the WHO found that much of the population existed in a state of ``semi starvation.''
LU Factuality: Hall will be only the second member of Congress to travel in Iraq since the war, according to Hall's office.
LU Factuality: The last visitor was then-U.S. Rep. Bill Richardson of New Mexico, who went to help a pair of U.S. oilmen in diplomatic trouble.
LU Factuality: Hall flies to Amman, Jordan, on Friday, where he'll spend the night before driving to Iraq.
LU Factuality: Flights are not permitted into Iraq.
LU Factuality: Hall is to return to Washington on April 22.
LU Factuality: Story Filed By Cox Newspapers
LU Factuality: U.S. Congressman Arrives in Iraq for Landmark Visit BAGHDAD, April 16 (Xinhua) --
LU Factuality: U.S. Congressman Tony Hall arrived here Sunday evening, becoming the first U.S. lawmaker to visit Iraq since the 1991 Gulf War.
LU Factuality: Hall, heading a three-member delegation, arrived here at 19:17 (1517 GMT) by land from Jordanian capital Amman, and stayed at the five-star Mansour Hotel.

LU Factuality: At the entrance of the Mansour Hotel, Hall made a brief statement, saying that he came to Iraq because he has heard for a long time about the humanitarian situation here, especially the malnutrition among the Iraqi children and the increasing mortality rate of the children and the elderly.

input_text:
LU Factuality: XIE20000420.0165
2000-04-20 
U.S. Congressman Concludes Landmark Visit to Iraq BAGHDAD, April 20 (Xinhua) –
LU Factuality: U.S. Democratic Party Congressman Tony Hall left here Thursday after concluding his landmark visit to Iraq, which has been under sweeping U.N. sanctions since 1990.
LU Factuality: In a statement, Hall expressed regret over the negative impacts of the decade-old sanctions on Iraqi people.
LU Factuality: During his four-day stay, Hall visited hospitals and health institutions in Baghdad and the southern Muthana Province.

LU Factuality: The U.S. lawmaker got acquainted with the sufferings of the Iraqi children because of acute shortage of food and medicine as a direct result of the embargo, reported the Iraqi News Agency (INA).

Inauguration of free zone in Dubai for e-commerce
LU Factuality: Dubai 10-28 (FP) - Dubai's Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum inaugurated a free zone for e-commerce today, called Dubai Internet City.
LU Factuality: The preliminary stages of the project, the only one of its kind according to its designers, are estimated at $200 million.
LU Factuality: Sheikh Mohamed, who is also the Defense Minister of the United Arab Emirates, announced at the inauguration ceremony that "we want to make Dubai a new trading center."

input_text: LU Factuality: The minister, who has his own website, also said: "I want Dubai to be the best place in the world for state-of-the-art technology companies."

input_text: LU Factuality: The e-commerce free zone is situated in north Dubai, near the industrial free zone in Jebel Ali, the top regional and tenth international leading area in container transit.
LU Factuality: The inauguration of Dubai Internet City coincides with the opening of an annual IT show in Dubai, the Gulf Information Technology Exhibition (Gitex), the biggest in the Middle East.

input_text: LU Factuality: The enemy confronting our society falls in three categories:
LU Factuality: Hostile intelligence organizations, such as the United States, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Pakistan and the Jews.
LU Factuality: The straying group who are atheists and apostates.
LU Factuality: The existing environment.
LU Factuality: They include the deposed regime, the tribal cliques, the hired fighters, and the standard criminals.
LU Factuality: The above groups pose the following dangers:
LU Factuality: Attacking for the purpose of:
LU Factuality: Aerial raids and artillery attacks
LU Factuality: Setting fires
LU Factuality: Technical sabotage
LU Factuality: Chemical sabotage
LU Factuality: Recruiting a member of society
LU Factuality: Planting a mole within society
LU Factuality: Spying surveillance operation
LU Factuality: Pests:
LU Factuality: Poisonous such as snakes and scorpions
LU Factuality: Harmful such as rats and cockroaches
LU Factuality: Sickening such as mosquitoes
LU Factuality: In order to face these dangers, we resort to a plan which includes the external factors, the internal factors and spying.

input_text: LU Factuality: All actions and methods adopted to confront dangers from outside.
LU Factuality: All actions and methods adopted to confront dangers from within.
LU Factuality: Spying:
LU Factuality: Confronting infiltration operations carried out by spying agents or moles.
LU Factuality: External Security
LU Factuality: Choosing the Location
LU Factuality: Choosing mountainous locations, preferably 1-3 hours from main cities, which have water resources.
LU Factuality: Being close to cities is important in order to have important services.
LU Factuality: If a mountainous location is unviable, then choose a location next to official Buidings so as to avoid being bombarded.
LU Factuality: Again, if the above is not possible, then choose a location next to residential areas, for the same reason as above.
LU Factuality: The location should be away from airports and main highways.
LU Factuality: It is preferable it has its own private access in order to protect it and control it better.
LU Factuality: Protection Methods
LU Factuality: Outside Protection:
LU Factuality: Human protection
LU Factuality: - Patrols close to locations
LU Factuality: - Patrols distant from the location.
LU Factuality: Animal protection:
LU Factuality: Electronic protection:
LU Factuality: Permanent Protection:
LU Factuality: They are erected according to the nature of the location.
LU Factuality: They can take one of the following forms:
LU Factuality: Insert 4 inch pipes in the ground at 50 centimeters apart and a height of one meter then fill them with cement.
LU Factuality: They are filled with cement and place around the building, especially at the entrance to prevent cars from crashing into it.
LU Factuality: They are better than road bumps because they are harder to see.
LU Factuality: The ditch should be 30 centimeters deep and 20 centimeters wide.
LU Factuality: Passage ways for cars and pedestrians should be designated.
LU Factuality: Road bumps: Six successive bumps should be constructed at 500 meters from the location.

LU Factuality: The distance between the first and fourth bump should be 100 meters, and the distance between the fourth and the sixth should be 50 meters, so cars cannot travel fast in the direction of the building.
LU Factuality: Barbed Wires: They should be placed around the building, around the walls, or on top of the walls.
LU Factuality: These are placed at the main gate in order to puncture the tires of any car crashing in.
LU Factuality: Fences are the best form of permanent protection.
LU Factuality: It shields off all activities which take place inside the location.
LU Factuality: The following should be considered when erecting fences:
LU Factuality: The fence which is built out of bricks or concrete should be 4 meters high, then topped with one meter high barbed wire fence.
LU Factuality: It is preferable that the barbed wires slant outwards at a 70 degrees angle.
LU Factuality: The thickness of the fence should be 60 cm and the distance between it and the building should be 2 meters.
LU Factuality: Secret gates should be built 50 meters apart to be used for emergency only.
LU Factuality: However, they should not be identifiable from the outside part of the fence.
LU Factuality: It is preferable that any location has only 2 emergency gates and far away from one another.
LU Factuality: No other outside gates should be erected.
LU Factuality: If it is necessary to have an outside entrance for the control tower, then access to the location should not be constructed.
